page.title: 11Visitors to W. B'fastleigh
page.content:
Although there are few facilities for tourists, it is hard to imagine a more pleasant area for getting away from the hustle and bustle of town life. It is splendid walking country, with lovely river valleys to explore and easy access to{Dartmoor.
We found summer visitors who had rented cottages, a few campers, and a number of cars parked at Cross Furzes, their owners presumably engaged in tramping along the Abbot's Way.
And all roads lead to the{Tradesman's {Arms}at Scorriton, where many visitors (and locals) could be found enjoying the real ale and the local cider at lunchtime.
